Description: This template creates IP access list entries for an existing MongoDB Atlas Service Account. This example demonstrates both CIDR block and IP address entries.

OrgId.Description: Unique 24-hexadecimal digit string that identifies the organization.

ClientId.Description: The Client ID of an existing Service Account. Get this from the MongoDB Atlas UI or from a previously created Service Account.

CIDRBlock.Description: Range of IP addresses in CIDR notation to be added to the access list (e.g., 203.0.113.0/24).

IPAddress.Description: Single IP address to be added to the access list (e.g., 198.51.100.10).

Profile.Description: Secret Manager Profile that contains the Atlas Programmatic keys

CIDREntryCreatedAt.Description: Date and time when the CIDR entry was created

CIDREntryRequestCount.Description: Total number of requests from the CIDR entry

IPEntryCreatedAt.Description: Date and time when the IP entry was created

IPEntryRequestCount.Description: Total number of requests from the IP entry
